alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Eastern Chester; Eastern Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 2:51PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Montgomery, east central Chester, southwestern Philadelphia and Delaware Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 251 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gradyville, or near West Chester, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, West Chester, Yeadon, Westtown, Folcroft, Swarthmore, Narberth, East Lansdowne, Darby Township, Cheyney, Morris Park, Bryn Mawr, Trout Lake, Radnor Township, Gradyville, Broomall, Newtown Square, Roxborough, Drexel Hill and Lima. This includes the following highways... Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 335 and 350. Interstate 676 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 0. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 2 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Delaware; Eastern Chester; Eastern Montgomery; Philadelphia
